member.name: PROCESSOR_POWER_POLICY
member.summary: Contains information about processor performance control and C-states.

member.name: PROCESSOR_POWER_POLICY.Revision
member.summary: The current structure revision level. Set this value by calling before using a PROCESSOR_POWER_POLICY structure to set power policy.

member.name: PROCESSOR_POWER_POLICY.DynamicThrottle
member.summary: The current processor performance state policy. This member must be one of the values described inProcessor Performance Control Policy Constants.

member.name: PROCESSOR_POWER_POLICY.PolicyCount
member.summary: The number of elements in the Policy array.

member.name: PROCESSOR_POWER_POLICY.Policy
member.summary: An array of structures that defines values used to apply processor C-state policy settings. Policy[0] corresponds to ACPI C-state C1, Policy[1] corresponds to C2, and Policy[2] corresponds to C3. The AllowPromotion member determines whether the processor can be promoted to the state. For example, if Policy[0].AllowPromotion is 0, the computer cannot transition from C0 to C1.
